fork_status_and_schedule.highlight: Hegotá headliner decision deferred two weeks; no decision made today
Decision deadline: next ACDE call in two weeks

devnet_updates.highlight: blob-devnet-0 testing partial clouds; Lighthouse and Prism onboarded
bal-devnet-2 testing local access lists; eTrex syncing, Erigon issues remain
nft-devnet-10 testing EIP-870 P2P protocol with increased header sizes
perf-devnet-3 relaunched after chain halt; previous instance unrecoverable
bal-devnet-3 launches next Wednesday; scope includes EIP-7954, optional 870/871
EIP-8037 downscoped to static value increase only for devnet-3
Static value: cost_per_state_byte = 1174 at 100M block gas limit
Test release target: end of tomorrow (Feb 27)

headliner_discussion.highlight: EIP-8105 withdrawn; champions endorse Lucid as consolidated encrypted mempool proposal
Lucid EIP still in draft; will be shared over weekend
Erigon position: prefers Lucid or Frame; strongly opposes no headliner
Besu position: prefers Lucid; Frame acceptable as second choice
Geth position: Frame Transactions preferred; Lucid and SSZ not mature enough
Nethermind position: not convinced by complexity of either Frame or Lucid
Reth position: Frame over-engineered; SSZ has low benefit-to-work ratio
Nimbus EL position: prefers SSZ with Frame; Frame acceptable without SSZ
Main debate: Frame Transactions vs no EL headliner
Frame Transactions removes protocol signature requirements entirely
Frame TX enables privacy pools without centralized relayers
Lucid and SSZ remain under consideration pending two-week discussion period

miscellaneous.highlight: Era E successor format fully deprecates Era 1; Geth implementation merged
Txpool namespace standardization PR open; Besu supports, some naming differences exist

action_items.action: Review and comment on txpool namespace standardization PR
Schedule Frame Transactions breakout call before next ACDE
Lucid champions: address metadata leakage questions in Discord thread

targets.target: March 12 - Hegotá headliner decision deadline (next ACDE)
March 5 - Encrypted Mempool working group call to discuss Lucid
